title: Noise-reduction device for automobile air-conditioning circuit, conduit and circuit comprising same
abstract: The conduit has a noise reducer device (607) in its internal space and mounted to contact a wall of the conduit. The device has geometry of a tubular part delimited by two transversal inlet and outlet faces (608, 609) for fluid and by an external radial face (610) which connects the inlet and outlet faces. The inlet and outlet faces form an axial channel (612) for passage of fluid in the device. The external face is partly cylindrical and matches with the conduit wall. Ratio of a minimal passage section of the channel and a transversal section of the external face is between 0.05 and 0.75.

motivations: Noise in automobile air-conditioning circuits is a problem that needs to be addressed.
objectives: Design a noise-reduction device for automobile air-conditioning circuits.
methods: Develop a device with a specific geometry that can be mounted inside a conduit to reduce noise.
Use a tubular part with inlet and outlet faces and an external radial face to create an axial channel for fluid passage.
results: Reduce noise in automobile air-conditioning circuits.
llama_json.research_subject: Noise reduction in automobile air-conditioning circuits

motivations: There is a need to reduce noise in automobile air-conditioning circuits.
objectives: Design a noise reduction device for automobile air-conditioning circuits that can be mounted internally and in contact with the conduit wall.
methods: The noise reduction device is designed with a tubular part, delimited by two transversal inlet and outlet faces for fluid, and an external radial face connecting the inlet and outlet faces.
The external face of the device is partly cylindrical to match with the conduit wall.
The ratio of a minimal passage section of the channel and a transversal section of the external face is maintained between 0.05 and 0.75.
results: The noise reduction device can be effectively installed in the conduit of an automobile air-conditioning circuit to reduce noise.
openai_json.research_subject: Noise-reduction device for automobile air-conditioning circuit

motivations: Automobile air-conditioning systems generate undesirable noise that affects passenger comfort and vehicle quality.
There is a need for effective noise reduction solutions that can be integrated into existing air-conditioning circuit conduits.
objectives: Design and develop a noise-reduction device that can be installed within automobile air-conditioning circuit conduits.
Optimize the device geometry to achieve effective noise reduction while maintaining proper fluid flow characteristics.
methods: Design a tubular noise reducer device with specific geometric features including inlet/outlet faces and an external radial face that matches the conduit wall.
Configure the device with an axial channel for fluid passage and optimize the ratio between the channel's minimal passage section and the external face's transversal section.
results: The device achieves noise reduction in automobile air-conditioning systems through its specialized geometry and internal mounting configuration.
The optimized passage section ratio between 0.05 and 0.75 ensures effective noise reduction while maintaining adequate fluid flow.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Noise-reduction device for automobile air-conditioning circuits
